items.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18705)
items.content_html:
Twitter @leslieherod was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=leslieherod&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere

items.title: "A Georgia sheriff’s captain tried to convince the public...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"A Georgia sheriff’s captain tried to convince the public Wednesday morning that a man charged with fatally shooting several people of Asian descent the night before was not motivated by race."

HuffPost

Cherokee County sheriff's Capt. Jay Baker promoted merchandise last year that demonized the Asian community in relation to COVID-19.

huffpost.com

Cop Who Said Spa Shooter Wasn’t Racist Against Asians Previously Promoted Racism Against Asians

Cherokee County sheriff's Capt. Jay Baker promoted merchandise last year that demonized the Asian community in relation to COVID-19.Cherokee County sheriff's Capt. Jay Baker promoted merchandise last year that demonized the Asian community in relation to COVID-19.

items.title: “DENVER — Collective grief continues through Colorado's...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

“DENVER — Collective grief continues through Colorado's Asian American and Pacific Islander community, causing fear and uncertainty according to those who shared their lived experiences.”

Collective grief continues through Colorado's Asian American and Pacific Islander community, causing fear and uncertainty according to those who shared their lived experiences with Denver7.

thedenverchannel.com

Members of Denver's Asian American, Pacific Islander communities share collective grief following Atlanta spa shootings

Collective grief continues through Colorado's Asian American and Pacific Islander community, causing fear and uncertainty according to those who shared their lived experiences with Denver7.Collective grief continues through Colorado's Asian American and Pacific Islander community, causing fear and uncertainty according to those who shared their lived experiences with Denver7.

Tune in to hear me and Narkita Gold Studio discuss THE famous Black in Denver exhibit that has taken our city by storm.

items.title: "Colorado lawmakers have introduced several bills this...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Colorado lawmakers have introduced several bills this session meant to shield immigrants from being arrested over civil immigration violations..."

The Denver Post

A look at four bills in the Colorado Legislature that would significantly change to how the state interacts with immigrants who are living in the U.S. without legal permission.

denverpost.com

Colorado bills seek to shield immigrants from ICE, provide legal representation

A look at four bills in the Colorado Legislature that would significantly change to how the state interacts with immigrants who are living in the U.S. without legal permission.A look at four bills in the Colorado Legislature that would significantly change to how the state interacts with immigrants who are living in the U.S. without legal permission.

items.title: "Gov. Jared Polis and bipartisan legislative leaders rolled...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Gov. Jared Polis and bipartisan legislative leaders rolled out a long-awaited $700 million stimulus plan Wednesday, dedicating large pots of money to expected areas like highway repairs but also setting aside funds to help large events and to give more sales-tax relief to struggling restaurants."

Denver Business Journal

Legislative leaders said they will seek to turn around the series of bills quickly so that they can be passed quickly and get money into the hands of individuals and businesses.

bizjournals.com

Polis, legislators unveil $700 million Colorado stimulus package - Denver Business Journal

Legislative leaders said they will seek to turn around the series of bills quickly so that they can be passed quickly and get money into the hands of individuals and businesses.Legislative leaders said they will seek to turn around the series of bills quickly so that they can be passed quickly and get money into the hands of individuals and businesses.

items.title: "They mark their intermittent triumphs by the decade: the...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"They mark their intermittent triumphs by the decade: the Palmer High School Terrors changed their Eaglebeak mascot from a caricature of an Indian to an actual eagle in the ‘80s; in 1995, the University of Southern Colorado changed its Indians mascot to the ThunderHawks.
And there still are 24 Colorado K-12 schools with native mascots."

The Colorado Sun

COLORADO SPRINGS — When Stephanie Jerome and her family moved a year ago to Colorado Springs, she took her daughter to the Cheyenne Mountain School District office to enroll her in fifth grade. There they learned that the district’s high school sports teams were called Indians. And so she enroll...

coloradosun.com

25 Colorado schools still had Native American mascots. This week one finally decided to make a change.

COLORADO SPRINGS — When Stephanie Jerome and her family moved a year ago to Colorado Springs, she took her daughter to the Cheyenne Mountain School District office to enroll her in fifth grade. There they learned that the district’s high school sports teams were called Indians. And so she enroll...COLORADO SPRINGS — When Stephanie Jerome and her family moved a year ago to Colorado Springs, she took her daughter to the Cheyenne Mountain School District office to enroll her in fifth grade. There they learned that the district’s high school sports teams were called Indians. And so she enroll...

items.title: Congratulations Representative Brianna Titone for being our next...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

Congratulations Representative Brianna Titone for being our next LGBTQ Caucus Chair!

Colorado Politics

The Arvada Democrat in a statement touted the “great strides” the caucus had made for LGBTQ Coloradans, including “banning conversion therapy, updating laws so Coloradans can more easily obtain ID

coloradopolitics.com

Titone to chair the legislative LGBTQ Caucus

The Arvada Democrat in a statement touted the “great strides” the caucus had made for LGBTQ Coloradans, including “banning conversion therapy, updating laws so Coloradans can more easily obtain IDThe Arvada Democrat in a statement touted the “great strides” the caucus had made for LGBTQ Coloradans, including “banning conversion therapy, updating laws so Coloradans can more easily obtain ID

items.title: “Black, brown, queer and disabled kids are disproportionately...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Black, brown, queer and disabled kids are disproportionately impacted by harsh discipline policies, and we have to change it.”

The Colorado Sun

By Jason Gonzales, Chalkbeat Colorado Colorado school districts would have to reduce suspensions and set higher standards for school resource officers under a state bill introduced Friday that takes aim at what’s called the school-to-prison pipeline. The bill also bans the use of handcuffs on elem...

coloradosun.com

Children of color are much more likely to face harsh school discipline. A Colorado bill seeks to change that.

By Jason Gonzales, Chalkbeat Colorado Colorado school districts would have to reduce suspensions and set higher standards for school resource officers under a state bill introduced Friday that takes aim at what’s called the school-to-prison pipeline. The bill also bans the use of handcuffs on elem...By Jason Gonzales, Chalkbeat Colorado Colorado school districts would have to reduce suspensions and set higher standards for school resource officers under a state bill introduced Friday that takes aim at what’s called the school-to-prison pipeline. The bill also bans the use of handcuffs on elem...

items.title: “No one should refer a child to law enforcement for normal...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

“No one should refer a child to law enforcement for normal youth behaviors. That’s the key in our bill.” - State Representative Leslie Herod

Members of Colorado’s Black caucus looking to change the “school-to-prison pipeline” with handcuff ban and cutting back on reasons to arrest older students.

denverpost.com

With governor’s backing, Black lawmakers seek to ban handcuffing young kids in Colorado schools

Members of Colorado’s Black caucus looking to change the “school-to-prison pipeline” with handcuff ban and cutting back on reasons to arrest older students.Members of Colorado’s Black caucus looking to change the “school-to-prison pipeline” with handcuff ban and cutting back on reasons to arrest older students.

items.title: "Wayne Lolotai is no longer a member of the Boulder Police...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Wayne Lolotai is no longer a member of the Boulder Police Department, but his legacy lingers. The City of Boulder has just been sued over his 2019 attack on Sammie Lawrence, a young man who walks with the assistance of a cane..."

@ Denver Westword

The officer was involved in multiple controversial incidents.

westword.com

Notorious Ex-Cop Sued for Attacking Man Who Needs Cane to Walk

The officer was involved in multiple controversial incidents.The officer was involved in multiple controversial incidents.

Representative Leslie Herod

Check out my Live with @dshootsbossup where we discussed our experiences working while Black, how we protect our peace, and more!

items.title: "Thousands of kids were freed from juvenile detention...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Thousands of kids were freed from juvenile detention during the pandemic. They were more likely to be White, data shows."

The Marshall Project

Thousands of kids were freed from juvenile detention during the pandemic. They were more likely to be White, data shows.

themarshallproject.org

Many Juvenile Jails Are Now Almost Entirely Filled With Young People of Color

Thousands of kids were freed from juvenile detention during the pandemic. They were more likely to be White, data shows.Thousands of kids were freed from juvenile detention during the pandemic. They were more likely to be White, data shows.

items.title: Alongside Julián Castro, we dissect the gaps in mental health...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

Alongside Julián Castro, we dissect the gaps in mental health services, and further discuss the STAR program here in Denver.
To dive deeper with us, tune into the podcast episode below!

@ouramerica

‎Show Our America with Julián Castro, Ep Who Responds to a Mental Health Crisis? (with Rep Leslie Herod) - Mar 11, 2021

podcasts.apple.com

‎Our America with Julián Castro: Who Responds to a Mental Health Crisis? (with Rep Leslie Herod) on Apple Podcasts

items.title: What if we had mental health professionals responding to...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

What if we had mental health professionals responding to emergencies? In Denver we are doing just that.

I’m super excited to share that my talk about Denver’s STAR Team has been boosted to a full-fledged Ted Talk! If you haven’t already, take a listen and let me know what you think about what we’ve been up to.

TED

When you report an emergency in the US, police, firefighters or paramedics answer the call. What if mental health professionals responded, too? Colorado State Representative Leslie Herod shares a straightforward and research-backed approach that brings heart and humanity to criminal justice rather t...

ted.com

What if mental health workers responded to emergency calls?

When you report an emergency in the US, police, firefighters or paramedics answer the call. What if mental health professionals responded, too? Colorado State Representative Leslie Herod shares a straightforward and research-backed approach that brings heart and humanity to criminal justice rather t...When you report an emergency in the US, police, firefighters or paramedics answer the call. What if mental health professionals responded, too? Colorado State Representative Leslie Herod shares a straightforward and research-backed approach that brings heart and humanity to criminal justice rather t...

items.title: "The boldest change would be to abolish the federal death...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The boldest change would be to abolish the federal death penalty, which would require an act of Congress. Some lawmakers are already considering that, but in the meantime, there are other ways Biden could undermine Trump’s efforts to reinvigorate capital punishment"

The Marshall Project

Biden vowed to end the death penalty. A recent court filing suggests where he might start.

themarshallproject.org

How Biden Can Reverse Trump’s Death Penalty Expansion

Biden vowed to end the death penalty. A recent court filing suggests where he might start.Biden vowed to end the death penalty. A recent court filing suggests where he might start.

items.title: "A year after Taylor's death, none of the officers who...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"A year after Taylor's death, none of the officers who fired their service weapons — a total of 32 rounds — face criminal charges directly over Taylor's killing. At least three officers with connections to the raid have been terminated from the force."

NPR

Taylor was shot and killed in her apartment by Louisville police last March. "I can't believe it's a year later and we're still just asking people to do the right thing," her mother said recently.

npr.org

A Year After Breonna Taylor's Killing, Family Says There's 'No Accountability'

Taylor was shot and killed in her apartment by Louisville police last March. "I can't believe it's a year later and we're still just asking people to do the right thing," her mother said recently.Taylor was shot and killed in her apartment by Louisville police last March. "I can't believe it's a year later and we're still just asking people to do the right thing," her mother said recently.

items.title: "About a third of Denver’s small businesses and a third...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"About a third of Denver’s small businesses and a third of its nonprofits that applied for more than $15 million in emergency federal stimulus grants received one. And even then, those downtown saw more payouts than anywhere else, city data shows."

The Denver Post

Less than a third of Denver’s small businesses in emergency federal stimulus grants received one. Some city council members and economic experts question whether Denver distributed the federal mone…

denverpost.com

A third of Denver’s small businesses and nonprofits received emergency COVID grants, but most are in downtown

Less than a third of Denver’s small businesses in emergency federal stimulus grants received one. Some city council members and economic experts question whether Denver distributed the federal mone…Less than a third of Denver’s small businesses in emergency federal stimulus grants received one. Some city council members and economic experts question whether Denver distributed the federal mone…

items.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...

📸 Paul Miller Photography
Hair: Dornise LaTone Afhair
Styling: LILFRESHSAM
